fields.instructions: Welcome to the Lighter Footprints experiment.

fields.description: Climate-controlled buildings cost a lot of energy. Adjusting the temperature by two degrees saves 2,000 pounds of CO2 a year.
fields.summary: Heating or cooling buildings less saves energy
fields.name: adjust-thermostat

fields.display_name: Eat locally grown food for lunch
fields.description: The food we eat comes from all over the world. How much CO2 this emits depends on your specific location and menu. On average, a person in the USA can save 1,400 pounds of CO2 per year by switching to locally grown food. We assume that one lunch is equivalent of 1.5 pounds of CO2 saved.
fields.summary: Less energy is used for transportation when only locally grown food is consumed
fields.name: eat-local-lunch

fields.display_name: Enable sleep function on your computer
fields.description:
Annual energy savings from enabling the sleep feature on a computer and monitor = 235 kWh.
Savings assumes a weighted average of consumer behavior rather than assuming computers are turned off all night, as well as that the computer and monitor are ENERGY STAR rated.
fields.summary: Your computer consumes less energy when it's asleep or turned off
fields.name: enable-computer-sleep

fields.description: The average number of pounds of CO2 equivalent per person per year that could be saved by recycling is 6.83 pounds for glass, 18.96 pounds for plastic, and 86.05 pounds for aluminum and steel cans. This is an average of 2.15 pounds a week, or .31 pounds a day.
fields.summary: Recycling processes used materials into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials.
fields.name: recycle

fields.description:
We assume a car averaging 22.4 miles per gallon. CO2 emissions are 19.53 pounds per gallon and 1.5 pounds per gallon of non-CO2 CO2 equivalent emissions. This means 0.94 pounds per mile. We assume a trip length of 5 miles.

If there are N carpoolers, the savings are (N-1) / N* 4.7. Hence for N=2 persons, the savings are 2.85 pounds. More carpoolers lead to more reductions.
fields.summary: Carpooling is more energy efficient than travelling alone in your car.
fields.name: share-your-ride

fields.display_name: Bike or take public transportation when you go out
fields.description: We assume a car averaging 22.4 miles per gallon and a trip length of 4 miles. CO2 emissions are 19.53 pounds per gallon and 1.5 pounds per gallon of non-CO2 CO2 equivalent emissions. This means 0.94 pounds per mile.
fields.summary: Reduce fossil fuel consumption and emissions by not driving a car
fields.name: bike-public-transport

fields.display_name: Turn water off while brushing your teeth
fields.description: Turning off the water while brushing saves 0.5 kWh per person per day. This assumes four minutes a day spent brushing (enough to account for brushing teeth twice daily) and typical energy use for water supply, treatment, and heating. With 1.52 CO2 per kWh this leads to a savings of 0.76 pounds of CO2 a day.
fields.summary: Don't leave the water running while you're brushing your teeth
fields.name: brushing-your-teeth

fields.display_name: Turn off your computer at night
fields.description:
The average computer uses about 120 Watts (75 Watts for the screen and 45 Watts for the CPU) whether you're using it or not.
One computer left on 24 hours a day will cause 1,500 pounds of CO2 to be emitted into the atmosphere.
fields.summary: Save energy and turn off your computer when it's not needed.
fields.name: computer-off

fields.description: Replacing the protein you get from beef with poultry can save you 1,555 pounds of CO2 emissions annually. Per day, this switch leads to 4.26 pounds of CO2 savings.
fields.summary: Beef production is very energy intensive
fields.name: no-beef

fields.description: The average number of pounds of CO2 equivalent per person per year that could be saved by recycling paper is 14.86 pounds for magazines, 89.76 pounds for newspapers, and 100 pounds for junk mail. These add up to 0.56 pounds per day.
fields.summary: Saving paper resources and production by recycling
fields.name: recycle-paper

fields.description: Air drying your clothes saves 723 pounds of CO2 every year, or 1.98 pounds per day.
fields.summary: Air drying your clothes saves gas or electricity
fields.name: air-dry-clothes

fields.description: You can save 500 pounds of CO2 a year by reducing waste at lunch time. This means packing your lunch in a reusable container, using reusable/washable utensils, and don’t use paper napkins.
fields.summary: Reduce the amount of waste you produce at lunch time.
fields.name: green-lunch

fields.description: The amount of CO2 saved by turning lights off is [60 watts / 1000 watts/kWh] * 1.52 pounds of CO2 per kWh, which equals 0.09 pounds of CO2 per bulb per hour. Assuming 5 bulbs are turned off for 5 hours, this saves 2.28 pounds of CO2 per day.
fields.summary: Turning lights off in areas that don't need them saves energy.
fields.name: lights-off

fields.display_name: Become a vegan for a day
fields.description: A plant-based diet saves 1,608 pounds of CO2 per year compared to the average diet.
fields.summary: Raising animals for meat is resource intensive
fields.name: vegan-for-a-day

fields.display_name: Wash your clothes with cold water
fields.description: You can save 400 pounds of CO2 a year by washing all your clothes with cold water.
fields.summary: Save energy by not heating water
fields.name: wash-cold-water
